## Textbooks

For those looking to get a head start on the course material, you can look over the following two textbooks, which cover the course topics in the same general order that we will cover them (although with very different approaches: the target audience for these tends to be software engineers, who have slightly different needs from us data scientists!)

* Goodrich, Michael T., Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser. 2013. *Data Structures and Algorithms in Python*. [<a href='https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/y7w4at9q4alw7isgz1k41/Data-Structures-and-Algorithms-in-Python.pdf?rlkey=y87xdgfa6es0zlf42fpd3xffx&dl=1' target='_blank'>PDF</a>] [<a href='https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/r5edxs4cmy8ioqk2r59n3/Data-Structures-and-Algorithms-in-Python.epub?rlkey=ap5fm5kccw1tgcoly6eqv1gpv&dl=1' target='_blank'>EPUB</a>]
* Lee, Kent D., and Steve Hubbard. 2015. *Data Structures and Algorithms with Python*. [<a href='https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/2m560ys212krcj6eb6pve/Data-Structures-and-Algorithms-with-Python.pdf?rlkey=83stlforw6h1s1ykavgoooahd&dl=1' target='_blank'>PDF</a>] [a href='https://www.dropbox.com/s/v5msmc0cs415l54/Data%20Structures%20and%20Algorithms%20with%20Python.epub?dl=1' target='_blank'>EPUB</a>]

## Online Resources

In terms of resources specifically aimed at data scientists, **Datacamp** has the following sequence of Python-based courses:

* <a href='https://www.datacamp.com/courses/intro-to-python-for-data-science' target='_blank'>Introduction to Python for Data Science</a>
* <a href='https://www.datacamp.com/courses/python-data-science-toolbox-part-1' target='_blank'>Python Data Science Toolbox (Part 1)</a>
* <a href='https://www.datacamp.com/courses/python-data-science-toolbox-part-2' target='_blank'>Python Data Science Toolbox (Part 2)</a>
* <a href='https://www.datacamp.com/courses/object-oriented-programming-in-python' target='_blank'>Object-Oriented Programming in Python</a>
